comments:

using j2sdk1.4.1_02.  The error occurs while attempting to run or debug a java
application.

Which version of Eclipse are you running ? Would it be eclipse 2.0.2 ?
VI to investigate.

That would be version 2.1.0.  I should have also mentioned that while the
problem occurs when starting the debugger on a java application, it _seems_ like
the problem really occurs when eclipse changes perspectives - say, java browsing
to debugging.  The initial perspective "goes away" - turns completely grey, and
while the maching is chugging away, the error dialog pop ups saying that there
was an internal error and eclipse is going to shutdown.

Can you please attach the contents of your .log file - this is located in 
workspace/.metadata/

I think that what you are seeing is a left over result of a bug that happened 
earlier.

If the log file is really huge, please just gather the logs entered in the 
same session as "Cannot initialize Drop" error.  Each session begins with an 
entry like "!SESSION ".

The log file is fairly large, it contains entries from January of this year. 
You can read the contents from: http://tomcat.colabnet.com/eclipse-log.  Looking
through the log, you may notice that the error also occured June 26 and June 30.
 Each error being the only error from their respective session.  The other error
I mentioned in my initial bug report happened on a second machine.  On Jul 8, I
had just started eclipse [for the first time that day] minutes before the error
occured.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 29528 ***
Sorry that was a ytpo - should have been duplicate of 29258.
